Welcome to How To Cook That I'm Ann ReardonÂ 
and I have been sent a great challenge byÂ Â

Ali Sanchez ... she says 'I was wonderingÂ 
if you could make a Minecraft cake usingÂ Â

all the ingredients and only the ingredientsÂ 
that are listed in the game?' Well, challengeÂ Â

accepted. Of course if you're looking for aÂ 
Minecraft cake for a birthday party I alreadyÂ Â

have several of those videos just search for 'AnnÂ 
Reardon and Minecraft cake' and you'll find them.Â Â

But for today's challenge we're trying toÂ 
do it the way they do it in game ğŸ˜So in theÂ Â

minecraft game itself if you're going to makeÂ 
a cake what you need is three buckets of milk,Â Â

two piles of sugar, one egg and three bunchesÂ 
of wheat and you get one very large cake!Â Â

Now a bucket or a pile is not the normalÂ 
measurements you see on recipes of course ... inÂ Â

my cookbook I put grams and ounces and cups butÂ 
definitely not buckets and piles ... becauseÂ Â

how big is a bucket and how big is a pile? Well toÂ 
figure out how much of the ingredients we're goingÂ Â

to use, the only clues we've got is if we lookÂ 
in-game as to how they source those ingredients.Â Â

So first of all for the milk to get a bucketÂ 
of milk you of course milk a cow. Now how muchÂ Â

milk you get from one cow depends on quite a fewÂ 
factors depending of course on the breed of theÂ Â

cow how close it is since it's carved how oftenÂ 
you milk it and the method you used to milk itÂ Â

but in general if you're milking a cow at home byÂ 
hand you're going to get around three and a halfÂ Â

liters there's quite a bit of variation there butÂ 
let's say three and a half liters in one bucketÂ Â

and we have three of those buckets of milkÂ 
to use for our cake. Next we have two pilesÂ Â

of sugar now how big is a pile of sugar? Well inÂ 
the game you get sugar from harvesting sugar caneÂ Â

and on each block you can see there that there'sÂ 
eight sugar canes on it and you can expect toÂ Â

get between 50 and 150 grams of sugar from eachÂ 
sugar cane depending on its size and its weight.Â Â

Now of course in the game they just put the sugarÂ 
on the crafting table and you just get sugar inÂ Â

real life you've got to juice that and then it'sÂ 
got to be heated to concentrate it and then it'sÂ Â

got to be crystallized down but just in a momentÂ 
on the crafting table we can do all that processÂ Â

get rid of all the equipment so there's a fair fewÂ 
leaps of faith in this game. So we have the twoÂ Â

piles of sugar fortunately i don't have to processÂ 
that from the sugar cane. We could also look at itÂ Â

a different way and say well each square block inÂ 
minecraft is one meter by one meter so one meterÂ Â

squared one. Meter squared of sugarcane willÂ 
usually yield about a kilo of sugar so there'sÂ Â

quite a bit of variation there obviously we haveÂ 
two piles of sugar and with those calculations weÂ Â

can go anywhere between 800 grams and two kilosÂ 
of sugar depending on how much you want to useÂ Â

in your cake recipe so we've got a bit of wiggleÂ 
room there which is good. Then moving on to theÂ Â

eggs eggs is probably the easiest a chicken willÂ 
usually lay one egg a day if it's a laying henÂ Â

and one egg is one egg so i guess that's all we'veÂ 
got to work with. Compared to the magnitude of theÂ Â

other ingredients really does seem like a smallÂ 
amount and then next of course we have the wheatÂ Â

one metre squared of organically grown wheatÂ 
well you don't spray pesticides in minecraftÂ Â

so i'm assuming it's organically grown if you hadÂ 
pesticides you'd get more per meter squared butÂ Â

let's go for organically grown ... that will giveÂ 
you approximately 550 grams of your wheat grainsÂ Â

and we have three bunches of wheat so that meansÂ 
we have 1650 grams of wheat grains to work with.Â Â

Now that we have the ingredients list sortedÂ 
with two piles of sugar 1650 grams of wheat oneÂ Â

lonesome egg and three three and a half litreÂ 
buckets of milk. Now that's a lot of milk it'sÂ Â

ten and a half liters all together and that's theÂ 
first thing people question about this recipe howÂ Â

can you possibly make a cake using that much milk?Â 
And we'll get to that in a minute but first of allÂ Â

i want to start with the wheat. We obviously needÂ 
to grind it up and there must be a lot of hiddenÂ Â

equipment in minecraft that we don't see andÂ 
then we need to sift the wheat ... I just wantÂ Â

the white part of the flour because it'll be wayÂ 
too dense to use a full wholemeal flour for a cakeÂ Â

so i'm going to waste a lot of the grain here.Â 
Now back to the milk now the milk that you buyÂ Â

in shops is homogenized and what that means is allÂ 
of the little fat particles are processed to makeÂ Â

them smaller and all the same size homo meaningÂ 
the same and so homogenized you're making it allÂ Â

the same size and what that does by making themÂ 
smaller than same size is it means they stay mixedÂ Â

into the milk. So back in the olden days if youÂ 
had milk delivered that was fresh milk the creamÂ Â

would float to the top nowadays that cream staysÂ 
mixed all the way through because the milk isÂ Â

homogenized. So you don't get one person gettingÂ 
all the cream and everyone else basically gettingÂ Â

skim milk from the underneath. So if you freshlyÂ 
milk a cow like we did in minecraft and then youÂ Â

left that milk in the refrigerator overnight doÂ 
they have refrigerators in minecraft? Then thatÂ Â

cream is going to slowly rise to the top and weÂ 
can scoop off that cream which is going to give usÂ Â

the fat that we need to make our cake so we don'tÂ 
need all the skim milk but we do need that amountÂ Â

of milk to get the amount of cream we need to makeÂ 
the cake. Here we go attempt number one i'm goingÂ Â

to use two cups of the flour keep the rest forÂ 
the frosting as i said, most of one pile of sugarÂ Â

and some milk. Then i think i'll separate the eggÂ 
and put the yolk in with the flour and mix that inÂ Â

it's really really dry that's because it's quiteÂ 
like still wholemeal even though we've left a lotÂ Â

of the whole meal out it's not acting like aÂ 
normal plain flour so we're gonna have to addÂ Â

a bit more milk in there and then to add someÂ 
air i'm gonna need to whisk the egg white andÂ Â

whisk the cream as well. There's no baking powderÂ 
in this recipe so we've got no way of adding airÂ Â

normally when you add baking powder it makes theÂ 
bubbles and that's what makes your cake rise soÂ Â

we can't do that using baking powder so i'm goingÂ 
to have to try and add air using the egg white andÂ Â

whipping the cream but the only problem is we'veÂ 
only got one egg white so this is a really denseÂ Â

solid cake mixture that we're getting here. FoldÂ 
in the egg white and the cream and that is justÂ Â

way too dense it's not aerating at all but neverÂ 
mind, let's tip that into a cake pan and spreadÂ Â

it out and into the oven it goes. Now Jedd pointedÂ 
out to me that in the game they use the craftingÂ Â

table only it doesn't get baked in the furnaceÂ 
so in that case we'd have raw cake batter butÂ Â

i'm going to bake this so that we can taste itÂ 
safely. It did rise a tiny bit but not much.Â Â

Now for the frosting i'm using some milk weÂ 
have plenty of that and the rest of the flourÂ Â

and the rest of the sugar and the remainder ofÂ 
the cream. So we've made it using everythingÂ Â

on the ingredients list in the proportionsÂ 
they gave us except for that leftover skimÂ Â

milk and the leftover husks from the wheat. SoÂ 
now we're going to heat that up and whisk itÂ Â

and continue to heat it until it startsÂ 
to bubble so that all that flour cooksÂ Â

and then you just leave that to cool and once it'sÂ 
room temperature you can whip it up and this makesÂ Â

a frosting, it's a bit like an ermine frostingÂ 
but modified to suit the minecraft ingredients.Â Â

So how does the cake look once it's baked wellÂ 
it's pretty flat and it feels well pretty solid.Â Â

Let's cut it open that is solid there's noÂ 
spring to it at all the texture is classic ofÂ Â

a few things. If you're trying to troubleshootÂ 
a cake recipe in my cookbook each chapter hasÂ Â

a food science introduction and the chapter onÂ 
cakes would be helpful for this particular cake.Â Â

Because what I did is I got the exact same cupcakeÂ 
recipe and I baked 30 different batches of itÂ Â

with slight variations on different ingredientsÂ 
changing one ingredient at a time so that youÂ Â

could see the difference that changing for exampleÂ 
decreasing the sugar what effect will that have onÂ Â

the cake. All the different variations you canÂ 
think of I baked them all separately so I couldÂ Â

cut the cupcakes open, take photos so you canÂ 
visually see what difference that's going to have.Â Â

Very exciting! Okay back to the minecraft cake soÂ Â

let's have attempt number two i've got the creamÂ 
from the three buckets of milk, flour and i'mÂ Â

using store-bought flour this time simply becauseÂ 
i can't be bothered grinding the weight again,Â Â

two piles of sugar and an egg now i am going toÂ 
make some adjustments to the recipe this timeÂ Â

we need baking powder. Now sodium bicarbonateÂ 
can be made chemically or it can be mined fromÂ Â

trona so that's something they could add into theÂ 
minecraft game if they didn't want you to makeÂ Â

that sort of leap of faith you also need it forÂ 
making glass but the glass recipe at the momentÂ Â

is just sand makes glass so they could add it inÂ 
but if they add everything it's going to get aÂ Â

bit too complicated so we'll just assume this oneÂ 
was supposed to be in there and they just didn'tÂ Â

want to add those tiny details. One change thatÂ 
does need to happen though is we're going to needÂ Â

three eggs instead of one. There's just not enoughÂ 
protein in there compared to the volume of flourÂ Â

and everything else we have to hold the structureÂ 
of this cake. Let's put some of that cream intoÂ Â

the mixer i'll keep some of it to use for theÂ 
frosting then add in the sugar and all three eggsÂ Â

and now i'm going to whisk that on high speedÂ 
until we get a thick frothy emulsion so it'sÂ Â

nice and airy. Then i'm going to add in theÂ 
flour and the baking powder and i'm siftingÂ Â

that in to add as much air as possible and thenÂ 
we're going to mix that till it's just combined.Â Â

Then tip that into the same size cake tin as weÂ 
used for the last one and bake it in the oven andÂ Â

look at that it is rising up and you can tellÂ 
already that it's going to be a fluffier cake.Â Â

Fresh out of the oven and you can see it has quiteÂ 
a bit more spring to it we'll leave that to coolÂ Â

and then we'll decorate it. For the frosting onÂ 
this one i'm just going to whip the leftover creamÂ Â

and then added in a thick layer on the top of theÂ 
cake to square it up. Now the cake in MinecraftÂ Â

is quite different it's one meter by one meterÂ 
squared for one and there's no way we can makeÂ Â

a cake that big with these ingredients but forÂ 
two it's got those red bits on top of the cakeÂ Â

and there was nothing red in the ingredientsÂ 
list so what should we use for the red bits?Â Â

I guess there are berries it's not raspberries butÂ 
it's berries but let's just make that raspberriesÂ Â

for today and we'll just add some raspberries onÂ

the minecraft cake. This is gonna need a tasteÂ 
test the one on your right was made using theÂ Â

It's ... it's all right it'sÂ

but it's very stodgy and it reminds me of likeÂ

It's fluffy the cream'sÂ 
good and I love raspberries.Â Â

Much fluffier and sweeter I think I definitelyÂ

you have it slightly adjusting the recipe makesÂ
